intro: Cynoglossum alpinum, commonly known as alpine tongue-shaped flower, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. It is often found in meadows, cliffs, and forest edges at high altitudes. Cynoglossum alpinum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
